question_sentence: Which world leader arrived in Washington for a two-day visit?
evidence: Trade and immigration are high on the agenda as Modi and Donald Trump come face to face. The pair have historically enjoyed a warm relationship, although recent tariff threats and high-profile deportations of Indian nationals living illegally in the US have met with dismay in India.

question_sentence: What was the name of the giant schnauzer that won 'best in show' at the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show in New York?
evidence: The five-year-old giant schnauzer won best in show, becoming the first working group dog to win since 2004. He was followed closely by a 9½-year-old whippet named Bourbon, who was named reserve best in show for the third time.

question_sentence: In a new survey, what percentage of British Gen Zs said they would fight for their country?
evidence: Only one in 10 Britons aged 18-27 said they would take up arms to defend the country, according to a survey carried out by The Times. Patriotism among young Britons had undergone a steep decline, with only 41% expressing pride in their nationality, compared to 80% when a similar survey was conducted in 2004.

question_sentence: What colour Gatorade did the Philadelphia Eagles dump on their coach after winning the Super Bowl?
evidence: The Eagles defeated the Kansas City Chiefs 40-22 in Sunday's Super Bowl LIX and then carried on the tradition of drenching the winning coach in Gatorade. It was their second Super Bowl victory following their 2018 win against the New England Patriots.

question_sentence: Which country currently sits at the top of rugby's Six Nations table?
evidence: After two matches, the Irish men's side have beaten both England and Scotland, and will face Wales on 22 February. Ireland won both the 2023 and 2024 tournaments, and a victory this year would see the side equal England's record of seven wins. Scotland and Italy are the only two teams never to have won a Six Nations championship.

question_sentence: Which deep-sea fish has been spotted swimming in broad daylight for the first time?
evidence: Researchers recorded the first ever sighting of an adult Melanocetus johnsonii, known as a humpback anglerfish or black demon fish, in broad daylight. The nightmarish creature is typically found at depths between 670 and 6,560 feet but was spotted in shallow waters off the coast of Tenerife.

question_sentence: Which "junk food" staple is undergoing a surge of popularity in France?
evidence: News of France's love affair with the processed potato has been seized on with glee by English-language news outlets. French financial daily Les Echos reported this week that the so-called "Valley of the Fries" – the potato-growing heartlands of northern France – are bucking a wider economic slump thanks to the popularity of frozen oven chips (or fries, for US readers).

question_sentence: A study found that semaglutide, sold as Ozempic and Wegovy, reduces cravings for what?
evidence: A small-scale trial found that the drug used to treat type 2 diabetes and weight loss reduced alcohol cravings and consumption in people with moderate alcohol use disorder. Participants who received the drug consumed less alcohol on days they drank, though both groups drank about the same number of days per week.

question_sentence: World leaders attended a major conference on the future of AI in which European capital?
evidence: Days after J.D. Vance warned Europe against "overly precautionary" regulations on AI, more than 60 countries, including China, signed a declaration at the Paris conference committing to ensuring their use of the technology is "safe, secure and trustworthy". The US and the UK were among the countries who declined to sign the non-binding agreement.

question_sentence: Danish pranksters have launched a petition for which US state to be sold to Denmark?
evidence: As a counter to US President Donald Trump's proposal to buy Greenland, a petition has surfaced suggesting Denmark should purchase California. The petition has already garnered more than 200,000 signatures.

question_sentence: Which US currency may be on the way out after President Donald Trump suspended its production?
evidence: President Trump ordered the US Mint to suspend the production of pennies, citing the high cost of producing the one-cent coin.

question_sentence: Which food was recalled at major US retailers this week due to botulism risk?
evidence: Certain canned tuna products sold at Costco, Trader Joe's, Walmart and other retailers were recalled due to botulism risk. Symptoms of the rare but potentially fatal disease include muscle weakness, blurry vision, difficulty speaking and paralysis.

question_sentence: Which celestial event dazzled the night sky this week?
evidence: February’s full snow moon and a parade of planets were visible for lucky skygazers this week. The moon takes its name from the heavy snowfall typically associated with February, according to The Old Farmer’s Almanac.

question_sentence: Which global leader held a "lengthy and highly productive" phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin this week?
evidence: President Trump said negotiations to end the Ukraine war will start "immediately" after he held a "lengthy and highly productive" phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday.

question_sentence: Which type of dog breed won the highest honor at the 149th Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show?
evidence: A giant schnauzer named Monty won best in show at the prestigious Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show on Tuesday.

question_sentence: The Trump administration unveiled new tariffs this week, including a 25% duty on which imported goods?
evidence: President Trump on Monday imposed a 25% tariff on all steel and aluminum imports into the US with no exceptions or exemptions.

question_sentence: Around how many undocumented immigrants have been arrested in the US since President Trump's inauguration?
evidence: Roughly 14,000 undocumented immigrants have been arrested in the US since President Trump's inauguration on January 20, according to Trump's border czar Tom Homan. Border crossings are also down 92% during the same period, Homan said in an interview this week.

question_sentence: Which city debuted a toll program this year to decrease traffic congestion?
evidence: New York City’s congestion pricing policy — which charges drivers $9 a day during peak hours — is reaping benefits, local officials say. The program has resulted in less bumper-to-bumper traffic in central Manhattan, increased public transit use and more pedestrian activity in business districts.

question_sentence: Which popular European tourist destination doubled its entry fee for daytrippers?
evidence: It will cost 10 euros for daytrippers to visit the beloved Italian city of Venice on some days this summer. The fee is double from last year's 5 euros to help curb overcrowding.

question_sentence: Which NFL team won the Super Bowl in New Orleans?
evidence: The Philadelphia Eagles defeated the Kansas City Chiefs 40-22 in Super Bowl LIX. Around 127 million viewers tuned in to the big game, according to ratings data.
